title: Morgue near Tehran overwhelmed by bodies amid protest crackdown
subhed: Videos, uploaded to social media despite the internet shutdown in Iran, show a vast number of corpses piled up in the forensic center's warehouse and lined up in the yard. Witnesses corroborated the footage to Le Monde.
byline: By Ghazal Golshiri and Madjid Zerrouky

title: French PM Lecornu faces backlash after threatening snap elections
byline: By Marie Pouzadoux and Nathalie Segaunes

title: Trump's brute force will not drive China out of Latin America
Fed chair Powell says he is under federal investigation
subhed: Jerome Powell said US prosecutors have opened a probe into his comments to lawmakers and threatened an indictment.

title: Cuba's economy and stability are shaken by the Venezuela crisis
subhed: The fall of Nicolas Maduro threatens to deprive Havana of its main ally, Venezuela, which accounted for 10% of Cuba's trade in 2025. Despite support from Mexico and China, the island nation could see its economic – and social – crisis worsen dramatically.

title: 2026 Golden Globes: 'One Battle After Another' sweeps Best Film, Best Director and Best Screenplay
subhed: Paul Thomas Anderson's screwball thriller entered the night with nine nominations. Anderson won Best Director, while Teyanna Taylor snagged Best Supporting Female. The film's only major upset was its star Leonardo DiCaprio losing Best Actor to Timothée Chalamet for 'Marty Supreme.'
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: The British seniors trading tea dances at a daring cabaret
subhed: Once a month at London's The Posh Club, burlesque acts and striptease in a nightclub atmosphere delight Brits over 60, who let loose until late in the afternoon.

RN voters prefer Bardella over Le Pen, according to poll
subhed: The victimization strategy that Marine Le Pen, head of the far-right Rassemblement National party, adopted after her embezzlement conviction has failed to reach beyond her core base. Her party's voters see Jordan Bardella as more capable of leading France.

title: The Ukrainian-held Donbas, a land of ruins and grief
subhed: This region in eastern Ukraine now has only 200,000 inhabitants, compared to five million before the Russian invasion of 2022. Le Monde visited the area still under Kyiv's authority.

title: 'In Iran, the conditions that enabled the American operation in Venezuela are not present'
subhed: Political analyst Hamzeh Safavi, whose father is an adviser to Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, discusses the abduction of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro by the US on January 3 in Caracas, and its impact on the Islamic Republic.
